alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 20 at 12:18PM PST until February 22 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM TUESDAY TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 500 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches, except 4 to 8 inches in higher terrain above 1500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph, strongest Tuesday afternoon and evening a. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches possible. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast and Curry County Coast. For the Winter Weather Advisory, above 500 feet including Humbug Mountain and other areas away from the beaches. For the Winter Storm Watch, all areas, including Highway 101, and possibly even down to some area beaches. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 PM Tuesday to 10 AM PST Wednesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday evening through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
